abstract: Labor Dept reports worker productivity grew at annual rate of 3.3 percent in quarter from April to June.
lead_paragraph: Worker productivity increased at an annual rate of 3.3 percent in the April-June quarter, the Labor Department reported on Wednesday.

headline.main: Worker Productivity Growing, but Not at the Long-Term Rate
headline.print_headline: Worker Productivity Growing, but Not at the Long-Term Rate

snippet: Worker productivity increased at an annual rate of 3.3 percent in the April-June quarter, the Labor Department reported on Wednesday.
